com.ansca.corona
Class CoronaActivity

java.lang.Object
  Activity
      com.ansca.corona.CoronaActivity

public class CoronaActivity
extends Activity

The activity window that hosts the Corona project.

Nested Class Summary
static interface CoronaActivity.OnActivityResultHandler
          Handler that is invoked by the Corona activity when a result has been received from a child activity.

Method Detail

onCreate

protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
Called when this activity has been created, just before it starts. Initializes this activity's view and member variables.

Parameters:
savedInstanceState - If the activity is being re-initialized after previously being shut down, then this bundle contains the data it most recently supplied in onSaveInstanceState(). Otherwise it is null.

supportsOrientationChanges

public boolean supportsOrientationChanges()
Determines if this activity supports multiple orientations.

Returns:
Returns true if this activity's view can change orientations. Returns false if it has a fixed orientation.

supportsPortraitOrientation

public boolean supportsPortraitOrientation()
Determines if this activity supports a portrait orientation.

Returns:
Returns true if this activity supports a portrait orientation.

Returns false if this activity only support landscape.

supportsLandscapeOrientation

public boolean supportsLandscapeOrientation()
Determines if this activity supports a landscape orientation.

Returns:
Returns true if this activity supports a landscape orientation.

Returns false if this activity only support portrait.

hasFixedOrientation

public boolean hasFixedOrientation()
Determines if this activity only supports one orientation and it will never change.

Returns:
Returns true if this activity's view will never change orientation. Returns false if it supports multiple orientations.

setRequestedOrientation

public void setRequestedOrientation(int requestedOrientation)
Sets the orientation configuration for this activity.

Overridden to deny support for orientation settings that Corona does not support, such as settings that prevent Corona from predicting the orientation of the display. For example, ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_USER and ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_BEHIND might or might not support fixed orientations.

This activity will use ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_SENSOR if given ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_SENSOR.

This activity will use ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT if given the following orientations:

  • ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_USER
  • ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_BEHIND
  • ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_NOSENSOR

Parameters:
requestedOrientation - The orientation setting to be applied to this activity. Must be a "screen orientation" constant in class ActivityInfo.

getOverlayView

public android.widget.FrameLayout getOverlayView()
Gets the view that is overlaid on top of this activity's main OpenGL view.

This view is intended to be used as a container for other views such as text fields, web views, video views, ads, and other UI objects. All view objects added to this view group will be overlaid on top of the main Corona content.

Returns:
Returns a FrameLayout view group object that is owned by this activity.

Returns null if this activity has not been created yet or if the activity has been destroyed.

getInitialIntent

public android.content.Intent getInitialIntent()
Gets the intent that created and launched this activity.

Returns:
Returns the intent that created this activity.

getIntent

public android.content.Intent getIntent()
Gets the intent that last started/resumed this activity.

The returned intent will initially be the intent that created and launched this activity.

The returned intent will change when this activity is started by a call to the startActivity() or setIntent() methods, which typically happens external to this application such as when a notification gets tapped by the end-user or by another application such as Facebook.

Returns:
Returns the intent that last started this activity.

getHorizontalMarginInPixels

public int getHorizontalMarginInPixels()
Gets the horizontal margin of the Corona content. This is the distance between the origins of the screen and the Corona content.

Returns:
Returns the value in pixel units.

getVerticalMarginInPixels

public int getVerticalMarginInPixels()
Gets the vertical margin of the Corona content. This is the distance between the origins of the screen and the Corona content.

Returns:
Returns the value in pixel units.

getContentWidthInPixels

public int getContentWidthInPixels()
Gets the width of the Corona content.

Returns:
Returns the width in pixel units.

getContentHeightInPixels

public int getContentHeightInPixels()
Gets the height of the Corona content.

Returns:
Returns the height in pixel units.

convertCoronaPointToAndroidPoint

public android.graphics.Point convertCoronaPointToAndroidPoint(int x,
                                                               int y)

getHandler

public Handler getHandler()
Gets the activity's handler used to post messages and runnables to the message queue on the main UI thread.

You can call this method from any thread. The intention of this method is to provide a thread safe mechanism for other threads to post Runnable objects to be ran on the main UI thread.

Returns:
Returns a reference to the activity's handler which is associated to the main UI thread.

getRuntimeTaskDispatcher

public CoronaRuntimeTaskDispatcher getRuntimeTaskDispatcher()
Gets a dispatcher for sending CoronaRuntimeTask objects to the Corona runtime owned by this activity.

You can call this method from any thread. The intention of this method is to provide a thread safe mechanism for sending tasks to the Corona runtime thread so that you can access its Lua state.

Returns:
Returns a dispatcher for sending tasks to the Corona runtime thread.

Returns null if the CoronaActivity's onCreate() method has not been called yet.

registerActivityResultHandler

public int registerActivityResultHandler(CoronaActivity.OnActivityResultHandler handler)
Registers a handler to be called when a child activity's result has been received by the Corona activity's onActivityResult() method.

Parameters:
handler - The handler to be called when the child activity's result has been received.
Returns:
Returns a unique request code that you can pass into the startActivityForResult() method when launching the child activity.

Returns -1 if given a null argument.

If the given handler has already been registered, then this method returns the last request code that was assigned to it. This means that a handler cannot be assigend more than one request code.

unregisterActivityResultHandler

public void unregisterActivityResultHandler(CoronaActivity.OnActivityResultHandler handler)
Unregisters the handler that was given to the registerActivityResultHandler() method. This prevents that handler from getting called and frees its request code to be used for future registered handlers.

Parameters:
handler - Reference to the handler that was given to the registerActivityResultHandler() method.

onDestroy

protected void onDestroy()
Called just before this activity is closed and destroyed.

onStart

protected void onStart()
This method is called when the user navigates to this activity, forward or back, from another activity.

onResume

protected void onResume()
This method is called when this activity can be interacted with.

onPause

protected void onPause()
This method is called when this activity cannot be interacted with by the user, which can happen when:
  • Leaving this activity to go to another activity.
  • The power button was pressed or the screen lock is displayed.
  • The task manager view is overlayed on top of this activity.

onStop

protected void onStop()
This method is called when backing out of this activity or when displaying another activity. This method is NOT called when the user presses the power button or during screen lock. Because of this behavior, you never want to use this method to suspend the app.

onNewIntent

protected void onNewIntent(Intent intent)
This method is called when this activity is resumed with a new intent. This happens when the startActivity() or setIntent() methods get called for this activity.

Note that the getIntent() method will return the intent given to this method.

Parameters:
intent - The new intent that has started this activity. Typically indicates what this activity should display to the user.

onWindowFocusChanged

public void onWindowFocusChanged(boolean hasFocus)
This method is called when this activity has gained or lost the focus.

The activity window can lose the focus for the following reasons:

  • This window is no longer visible because another activity was shown.
  • This window is no longer visible due to screen lock or the press of the power button.
  • A dialog is displayed on top of this window, such as an alert, but this window is still visible.

Parameters:
hasFocus - Set true when this window has gained the focus. Set false when it has lost it.

onConfigurationChanged

public void onConfigurationChanged(android.content.res.Configuration newConfig)
Called when the device configuration changes, such as orientation changes.

Parameters:
newConfig - The new device configuration.

onActivityResult

protected void onActivityResult(int requestCode,
                                int resultCode,
                                Intent data)
Called when an activity you launched exits, yielding the results of that activity.

Parameters:
requestCode - The integer request code originally supplied to startActivityForResult(). Allows you to identify which activity the result is coming from.
resultCode - The integer result code returned by the child activity through its setResult().
data - An Intent object which can return result data to the caller. Can be null.

onKeyDown

public boolean onKeyDown(int keyCode,
                         android.view.KeyEvent event)
Called when a key has been pressed down.

Parameters:
keyCode - Unique integer ID of the key, matching a key code constant in the KeyEvent class.
event - Provides all information about the key event such as the key pressed, modifiers such as Shift/Ctrl, and the device it came from.
Returns:
Returns true if the key event was handled. Returns false if not.

onKeyUp

public boolean onKeyUp(int keyCode,
                       android.view.KeyEvent event)
Called when a key has been released.

Parameters:
keyCode - Unique integer ID of the key, matching a key code constant in the KeyEvent class.
event - Provides all information about the key event such as the key pressed, modifiers such as Shift/Ctrl, and the device it came from.
Returns:
Returns true if the key event was handled. Returns false if not.
